omnitronPoeMib.name: omnitronPoeMib
omnitronPoeMib.contactinfo: Omnitron Systems Technology, Inc. 38 Tesla Irvine, CA 92618-4670 USA Tel: (949) 250 6510 Fax: (949) 250 6514 E-mail: info@omnitron-systems.com International: +1 949 250 6510 Technical Support and Customer Service Tel: (800) 675 8410 E-mail: support@omnitron-systems.com International: +1 949 250 6510
omnitronPoeMib.description: Omnitron PoE MIB for use with iConverter Management Modules v5.2 and NetOutlook. Copyright 2015 Omnitron Systems Technology, Inc. All rights reserved.

ostPoeGlobalCfgPwrLimitationEnable.name: ostPoeGlobalCfgPwrLimitationEnable
ostPoeGlobalCfgPwrLimitationEnable.description: This object specifies whether the PoE PSE power limiting function is enabled. The value 'true' indicates that PoE PSE limiting is enabled. The value 'false' indicates that PoE PSE limiting is disabled.

ostPoeGlobalCfgTotalPwr.name: ostPoeGlobalCfgTotalPwr
ostPoeGlobalCfgTotalPwr.description: This object indicates the total power sourced in Watts.

ostPoePortCfgTable.name: ostPoePortCfgTable
ostPoePortCfgTable.description: This table supports the port PoE configurations.

ostPoePortCfgEntry.name: ostPoePortCfgEntry
ostPoePortCfgEntry.description: This is a PoE port configuration table entry.

ostPoePortCfgIndex.name: ostPoePortCfgIndex
ostPoePortCfgIndex.description: An index that is used to identify a specific PoE port number.

ostPoePortPseEnable.name: ostPoePortPseEnable
ostPoePortPseEnable.description: This object is the PoE PSE port enable. pseDisabled(1) PSE power source is disabled pseEnabled(2) PSE power source is enabled

ostPoePortPse60wMode.name: ostPoePortPse60wMode
ostPoePortPse60wMode.description: The object is the PoE PSE 60W mode enable. This is the same control as the physical DIP switch. pse60wNotAvail PSE 60W function not available pse60wAuto(1) PSE 60W auto mode enabled pse60wForce(2) PSE 60W force mode enabled

ostPoePortPdMode.name: ostPoePortPdMode
ostPoePortPdMode.description: This object is the PoE PD classification mode. pdModeNotDetected(1) PD is not detected pdModeNotClassified(2) PD is not classified pdModeFailure(3) PD classification failure pdModeClass0(4) PD is 802.3af Class 0 15W device pdModeClass1(5) PD is 802.3af Class 1 4W device pdModeClass2(6) PD is 802.3af Class 2 7W device pdModeClass3(7) PD is 802.3af Class 3 15W device pdModeClass4(8) PD is 802.3at Class 4 30W device pdMode60W(9) PD is 60W device

ostPoePortPseVoltageSupplied.name: ostPoePortPseVoltageSupplied
ostPoePortPseVoltageSupplied.description: This object indicates the voltage output from the PSE port in volts.

ostPoePortPseCurrentSupplied.name: ostPoePortPseCurrentSupplied
ostPoePortPseCurrentSupplied.description: This object indicates the current output from the PSE port in mA (milliamps).

ostPoePortPseStatus.name: ostPoePortPseStatus
ostPoePortPseStatus.description: This object is the PoE PSE port status. notApplicable(1) PD device not connected or port disabled pdNormal(2) PD device is being powered fully pdOverCurrent(3) PD device is consuming too much current pdBrownOut(4) PD device is not fully powered pdInsufficientPower(5) PD device not powered due to lack of power A write to this object restarts the PSE function and classification.

ostPoePortHeartbeatEnable.name: ostPoePortHeartbeatEnable
ostPoePortHeartbeatEnable.description: This object is the PoE PSE heartbeat enable. heartbeatDisabled(1) PSE PD heartbeat is disabled heartbeatEnabled(2) PSE PD heartbeat is enabled

ostPoePortHeartbeatIpAddress.name: ostPoePortHeartbeatIpAddress
ostPoePortHeartbeatIpAddress.description: This object is the PoE PD heartbeat IP address to ping.

ostPoePortHeartbeatInterval.name: ostPoePortHeartbeatInterval
ostPoePortHeartbeatInterval.description: This object is the PoE PSE PD heartbeat transmission interval in seconds.

ostPoePortHeartbeatErrorDetection.name: ostPoePortHeartbeatErrorDetection
ostPoePortHeartbeatErrorDetection.description: This object is the PoE PSE PD heartbeat number of consecutively lost heartbeat pings before an errored condition is declared. The number of consecutive error counts is cleared when a valid heartbeat response is received.

ostPoePortHeartbeatErrorAction.name: ostPoePortHeartbeatErrorAction
ostPoePortHeartbeatErrorAction.description: This object is the PoE PSE heartbeat errored condition action. errorLostIgnored(1) PD heartbeat errored condition is ignored errorRestart(2) PD heartbeat errored condition results in a restart errorShutdown(3) PD heartbeat errored condition results in a shutdown (power removed)

ostPoePortHeartbeatNumberRestarts.name: ostPoePortHeartbeatNumberRestarts
ostPoePortHeartbeatNumberRestarts.description: This object is the PoE PSE PD number of restarts when an errored hearbeat condition occurs. This object is only used when ostPoePortHeartbeatErrorAction is configured as 'errorRestart' A value of zero indicates restarts never stop.

ostPoEPortHeartbeatStatus.name: ostPoEPortHeartbeatStatus
ostPoEPortHeartbeatStatus.description: This object is the PoE PSE PD heartbeat status. heartbeatDisabled(1) PSE PD heartbeat is disabled heartbeatAvailable(2) PSE PD heartbeats are being received heartbeatErrored(3) PSE PD heartbeat is in an errored condition heartbeatRestart(4) PSE PD heartbeat error has caused a PSE restart heartbeatShutdown(5) PSE PD heartbeat error has caused a PSE shutdown

ostPoEPortHeartbeatDeferTime.name: ostPoEPortHeartbeatDeferTime
ostPoEPortHeartbeatDeferTime.description: This object is the PoE heartbeat PSE PD heartbeat transmission delay interval in seconds after the port has been reenabled. The delay is the amount of time after power has been applied before the heartbeat function starts and hence the detection of heartbeat errors.

ostPoeGroup.name: ostPoeGroup
ostPoeGroup.description: Mandatory objects for the PoE functional group.

ostPoeCompliance.name: ostPoeCompliance
ostPoeCompliance.description: The compliance statement for the Omnitron PoE MIB.
